basics.name: Louis Ledoux
basics.label: Researcher
basics.summary: A Computer Architect with a focus on Arithmetic and Floating-Points.

work.name: Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC) - RoMoL/CAOS/SONAR
work.summary: Conducting research in computer architecture, arithmetic, and HPC. Exploring co-designed hardware/software acceleration of posit arithmetic, developing Kulisch/Quire accumulators, and designing Systolic Array architecture for HPC workloads.
highlights: Co-designed hardware/software acceleration of posit arithmetic.
Developed Kulisch/Quire accumulators for any floating-point representation.
Designed Systolic Array architecture for HPC workloads.

work.name: b<>com
work.summary: Engaged in R&D focused on FPGA acceleration in the cloud. Successfully integrated an IP for real-time SDR to HDR video conversion, developed the IP integration using HDLs, and tweaked PCI-e drivers to maximize bandwidth.
highlights: Integrated an IP for real-time SDR to HDR video conversion.
Maximized PCIe bandwidth to approximately 15.8 GB/s.

work.name: WaryMe
work.summary: Developed the entire back end of a people security application. Ensured secure data transmission and deployed the application on AWS.
highlights: Deployed and managed the application on AWS.

work.name: ASKIA
work.summary: Developed an automated CLI tool for publishing surveys on popular platforms.
highlights: Developed an automated CLI tool for publishing surveys.

work.name: Radio Electronique Rennaise (R.E.R)
work.summary: Responsible for repairing various electronic devices, with an emphasis on audio equipment.
highlights: Repaired various electronic devices, focusing on audio equipment.
Soldered and reverse engineered amplifier circuits.

education.summary: Thesis: Floating-Point Arithmetic Paradigms for High-Performance Computing: Software Algorithms and Hardware Designs
Completed a three-year program culminating in an Engineer diploma and a Master's degree.
Intensive program with a strong emphasis on Mathematics and Computer Sciences.

publications.name: A Generator of Numerically-Tailored and High-Throughput Accelerators for Batched GEMMs
publications.publisher: 2022 IEEE 30th Annual International Symposium on Field-Programmable Custom Computing Machines (FCCM)
publications.summary: A generator for creating numerically-tailored and high-throughput accelerators specifically designed for batched GEMMs.

publications.name: An Open-Source Framework for Efficient Numerically-Tailored Computations
publications.publisher: 2023 33rd International Conference on Field-Programmable Logic and Applications (FPL)
publications.summary: An open-source framework aimed at enhancing the efficiency of numerically-tailored computations.

publications.name: The Grafted Superset Approach: Bridging Python to Silicon with Asynchronous Compilation and Beyond
publications.publisher: 2024 4th Workshop on Open-Source Design Automation (OSDA), hosted at DATE
publications.summary: The Grafted Superset Approach aims to bridge Python programming with silicon-level execution through asynchronous compilation.

publications.name: LLMMMM: Large Language Models Matrix-Matrix Multiplications Characterization on Open Silicon
publications.summary: Characterization of matrix-matrix multiplications for large language models using open silicon platforms.

publications.name: Open-Source GEMM Hardware Kernels Generator: Toward Numerically-Tailored Computations
publications.summary: A generator for open-source GEMM hardware kernels aimed at enabling numerically-tailored computations.

publications.name: Accelerating DL inference with (Open)CAPI and posit numbers
publications.publisher: OpenPOWER summit 2019, Lyon, France: Linux Foundation
publications.summary: Methods to accelerate deep learning inference using (Open)CAPI and posit numbers.

languages.fluency: Native speaker (with an honest French accent)

projects.name: MPW 5
projects.summary: Taped out a Systolic Array for Matrix Multiplication with Posit numbers and Quires accumulators.

projects.name: MPW 1
projects.summary: My first taped-out chip on the first-ever open shared Multi-Project Wafer in collaboration with Google, SkyWater, and Efabless.

projects.name: SUF
projects.summary: Developed a Python-to-ASIC compiler with a focus on arithmetic, including novel placement visualization.

projects.name: OSFNTC
projects.summary: Developed an Open-Source Framework for Efficient Numerically-Tailored Computation, systematically improving energy efficiency and accuracy.

projects.name: POF
projects.summary: Designed the Posit Operators Framework, a comprehensive SW/HW co-designed library for arithmetic computations using the Posit numerical format on FPGAs.

projects.name: VH2V
projects.summary: Designed a VHDL-to-Verilog translation tool tailored to convert FloPoCo outputs to OpenLane/OpenROAD inputs.

projects.name: Synthesizers
projects.summary: Crafted analog and digital synthesizers for modular synthesis and Eurorack systems.
